name: Smart Contract Audits
description: Security analysis and best practices for preventing vulnerabilities in smart contracts.

cards.title: Understanding Reentrancy Attacks
cards.description: Exploring the most notorious vulnerability in smart contracts and how to prevent it.
cards.bulletpoints: Reentrancy bug, withdrawal patterns, checks-effects-interactions pattern
cards.summaryText: Describe the reentrancy exploit sequence, illustrate unsafe withdrawal logic, and restate the checks-effects-interactions safeguard.

cards.title: Access Control & Role Management
cards.description: Ensuring only authorized entities can execute sensitive contract functions.
cards.bulletpoints: Ownable contracts, multi-signature wallets, role-based access control
cards.summaryText: Map how Ownable patterns, multisig approvals, and role-based checks gate privileged contract operations.

cards.title: Best Practices for Secure Smart Contracts
cards.description: Writing safe and efficient Solidity code to prevent security exploits.
cards.bulletpoints: Static analysis tools, security patterns, gas-efficient security measures
cards.summaryText: Highlight key auditing tools, repeat reusable security patterns, and balance safety tweaks with gas-aware tradeoffs.
